intro: Tovomita megantha, commonly known as the African star orchid, is a species native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family, characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Its leaves are broad and fleshy, adapted to store water in its natural habitat. Tovomita megantha is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
